hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 35 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
flabbergasted have you heard this word
before do you know what it means come
let's find out what flabbergasted means
and how to use it in your daily
conversation flabbergasted at some point
of time you must have felt surprised or
shocked it can be due to many reasons
like some sudden news you just heard or
by an unexpected incident that just
happened which can be good or bad
flabbergasted basically means to be very
shocked or surprised by something that
just happened it is generally used to
describe an individual's reaction of
being surprised or shocked due to a
pleasant or an unpleasant incident a
good news or a tragedy can leave someone
feeling flabbergasted in short anything
unexpected or sudden makes you feel
flabbergasted the word flabbergasted is
an adjective as it describes a feeling
of a person all right now you know what
flabbergasted means now let's listen to
some example sentences on how to use
this word in your daily conversation
example 1 Mary was flabbergasted when
her colleague put in her resignation
example two I was flabbergasted
unknowing about Sam's death in a road
accident example three you look very
flabbergasted do you have something to
say example for my mom was flabbergasted
when my dad told her that he had lost
his job example 5 people are
flabbergasted when they notice this
beautiful lady has two extra fingers
example 6 after seeing this wheely stunt
I think we all were flabbergasted
example 7 John was absolutely
flabbergasted to see the new surface
tablet by Microsoft featuring the new
Windows 8 operating system
example 8 the professor was
flabbergasted to see students attending
lectures on a Saturday early morning
